roleset.name: (cause to) become flat
roleset.note: FLATTEN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'flatten' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Member of VN class other_cos-45.4 and carve-21.2-1.Frames created by Olga, amended by Paul (from flatten.01-v)
FLATTENING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme data. Comparison to flatten.01-v. Flatten.01 is a member of VN classes carve-21.2-1 and other_cos-45.4.No FN class. Framed by Katie. (from flattening.01-n)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: The changes come as Reebok , which [*T*-1] grew rapidly in the mid-1980s but has seen its sales flatten of late , is seeking [*-2]to regain momentum in the athletic-shoe business against rivals Nike Inc. and L.A. Gear Inc .

example.name: with PRED
example.text: In areas where the freeway made giant concrete sandwiches of itself [*T*-3] lie [*T*-4]cars that police say [0] [*T*-2] -1 have been flattened [*-1] into foot-thick slabs .

example.name: with arg 1
example.text: mild flattening of the left ventral aspect of the pons
example.arg: of the left ventral aspect of the pons

example.name: nominal
example.text: Under these conditions, even a flattening out of economic growth -- ``catching cold'' -- in the healthy metropolitan areas will create significant opportunities for corporations and professional service firms looking for bargains as the realestate industry catches pneumonia.

roleset.name: lacking fizz
roleset.note: FLAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from flat.03-j)

example.name: the arg
example.text: I went around and asked the other tables to make sure that no one's soda was flat.

roleset.name: not shiny (as a surface)
roleset.note: FLAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from flat.04-j)

example.name: standard
example.text: The paint they chose for the kitchen was flat rather than glossy.
example.arg: The paint they chose for the kitchen

roleset.name: lowered slightly in pitch
roleset.note: FLAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from flat.02-j)

roleset.name: even, uniform, unvarying, horizontally level
roleset.note: FLAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, flatten-v.01, which corresponds to VNcls carve-21.2-1 other_cos-45.4. (from flat.01-j)

example.name: argMs
example.text: Sales were roughly flat in the 1989 model year compared with a year earlier , though industry sales fell .

example.name: flat tire
example.text: My car tire was flat tonight.

example.name: canonical flatness
example.text: The ground under the tent was flat.
